section.section: The Governor shall appoint the Commissioner with the advice and consent of the Senate.
The Commissioner shall serve for a term of 4 years.
The Commissioner is directly responsible to the Governor.
The Commissioner shall counsel and advise the Governor on all matters assigned to the Administration.

The Commissioner may be removed by the Governor for:
malfeasance;
incompetence; or
failure to carry out the duties of office in a manner consistent with the regulatory purpose and requirements of this article.
The Commissioner is responsible for the operation of the Administration.

The Commissioner shall:
exercise the powers and perform the duties of the Administration under this article;
organize the Administration to function efficiently and to serve the public; and
establish, in the Administration, the units necessary for the exercise of the powers and performance of the duties of the Administration.

text.section: The Commissioner shall devote full time to the duties of office.
The Commissioner is in the executive service of the State Personnel Management System and is entitled to compensation under the Executive Pay Plan in accordance with the State budget.
The Commissioner shall be covered by a surety bond in the form and amount required by law.

section.section: The Commissioner shall have a seal of office in the form approved by the Governor.
The impression and description of the seal shall be filed with the Secretary of State.
